output: For each test case print a single line with "Case #A: B" where A is the number of the test case (starting from 1) and B is the minimum possible P that makes the level possible to complete. B should be rounded to 4 digits after the decimal point. The input will be in a way that errors up to 10-5 will still give the correct answer.
input:
The first line contains T (T ≤ 100) – the number of test cases. After this line, T test cases follows. The first line of a test case contains one integer N (1 ≤ N ≤ 104) – the number of sets of walls. Next N lines contain the description of the set of walls in the following format: First the number K (0 ≤ K ≤ 10) – the number of walls present in this set. Next, there are K tuples of floating point numbers in the form: X,Y (0 ≤ X, Y < 2π) – the wall starts at an angle X and extends along the circumference in clockwise direction until angle Y. Walls of the same set do not intersect. None of the sets will never be a full circumference. When the game starts, the first set will hit the center after P seconds and the black point can start at any position.

                    The figure above illustrates the first sample test case.
name: Super Circumference
description:
Skyrk has developed a game called Super Circumference. Its simplicity is only rivalled by its monumental difficulty. The goal of Super Circumference is to control a point which runs around a central circumference while attempting to avoid contact with incoming circular walls.

                    

                    The black point circles around the red circumference at the speed of one full revolution per second. A level has several sets of incoming circular walls from which the point has to avoid contact. An incoming wall can be regarded as a circumference sector. The set of walls approach the center at the speed of one set every P seconds. The player wins the game if he successfully evade all walls.

                    A brand new level has been created with N sets of walls. To adjust its difficulty properly, you are asked to find the minimum possible value of P that still makes the level possible to complete.
